name: Securities Account Creation Request V01 (reda.018.001.01)
definition:
The SecuritiesAccountCreationRequest message message is sent by an instructing party to the executing party to instruct the creation of a new securities account with the required account attributes details.

Usage:
Processing and confirmation of the securities account creation request message are provided via a SecuritiesAccountStatusAdvice message.

children.name: Message Header
children.definition: Common business identification for the message.

children.name: Message Identification
children.definition:
Point to point reference, as assigned by the sender, to unambiguously identify the message.
Usage: The sender has to make sure that MessageIdentification is unique for a pre-agreed period.

children.name: Creation Date Time
children.definition: Date and time at which the message was created.

children.name: Securities Account
children.definition: Securities account to be created in the executing party system.

children.name: Account Owner
children.definition: Party that legally owns the account.

children.name: Identification
children.definition: Unique identification to unambiguously identify the party within the system.

children.name: Identification
children.definition: Unique identification of the party.

children.name: Any BIC
children.definition: Code allocated to a financial or non-financial institution by the ISO 9362 Registration Authority, as described in ISO 9362 "Banking - Banking telecommunication messages - Business identifier code (BIC)".

children.name: Proprietary Identification
children.definition: Unique and unambiguous identifier, as assigned to a financial institution using a proprietary identification scheme.

children.name: Identification
children.definition: Proprietary information, often a code, issued by the data source scheme issuer.

children.name: Issuer
children.definition: Entity that assigns the identification.

children.name: Scheme Name
children.definition: Short textual description of the scheme.

children.name: Name And Address
children.definition: Name and address of a party.

children.name: Name
children.definition: Name by which a party is known and which is usually used to identify that party.

children.name: Address
children.definition: Postal address of the party.

children.name: Address Type
children.definition: Identifies the nature of the postal address.

children.name: Address Line
children.definition: Information that locates and identifies a specific address, as defined by postal services, that is presented in free format text.

children.name: Street Name
children.definition: Name of a street or thoroughfare.

children.name: Building Number
children.definition: Number that identifies the position of a building on a street.

children.name: Post Code
children.definition: Identifier consisting of a group of letters and/or numbers that is added to a postal address to assist the sorting of mail.

children.name: Town Name
children.definition: Name of a built-up area, with defined boundaries, and a local government.

children.name: Country Sub Division
children.definition: Identifies a subdivision of a country for example, state, region, county.

children.name: Country
children.definition: Nation with its own government.

children.name: LEI
children.definition: Legal entity identification as an alternate identification for a party.

children.name: Responsible Party Identification
children.definition: Unique identification of the party responsible for the maintenance of the party reference data.

children.name: Identification
children.definition: Unique identification of the party.

children.name: Any BIC

children.name: Country Sub Division
children.definition: Identifies a subdivision of a country for example, state, region, county.

children.name: Country
children.definition: Nation with its own government.

children.name: LEI
children.definition: Legal entity identification as an alternate identification for a party.

children.name: Identification
children.definition: Unique and unambiguous identification for the account between the account owner and the account servicer.

children.name: Type
children.definition: Specifies the type of the securities account.

children.name: Code
children.definition: System securities account type, in a coded form.

children.name: Proprietary
children.definition: System securities account type, in a proprietary form.

children.name: Identification
children.definition: Proprietary information, often a code, issued by the data source scheme issuer.

children.name: Issuer
children.definition: Entity that assigns the identification.

children.name: Scheme Name
children.definition: Short textual description of the scheme.

children.name: Opening Date
children.definition: Legal opening date of the securities account.

children.name: Closing Date
children.definition: Legal closing date of the securities account.

children.name: Hold Indicator
children.definition:
Indicates whether the securities account is on hold or not.

Usage:
- Meaning when true: account is in hold status.
- Meaning when false: account is in release status.

children.name: Negative Position
children.definition: Indicates whether the securities account can hold a negative position in a security or not.

children.name: Market Specific Attribute
children.definition: Additional attributes defined by a central security depositary for a party.

children.name: Name
children.definition: Specifies the name of the market-specific attribute.

children.name: Value
children.definition: Specifies the value of the market-specific attribute.

children.name: Restriction
children.definition: Defines the specific processing characteristics for a securities account to ensure configurability of specific requirements, as prescribed by national legal and regulatory requirements and practices.

children.name: Valid From
children.definition: Specifies the date from which the restriction is valid.

children.name: Valid To
children.definition: Specifies the date until which the restriction is valid.

children.name: Type
children.definition: Specifies the identification of a restriction.

children.name: End Investor Flag
children.definition: Specifies information to identify securities accounts where allocation instructions are posted.

children.name: Pricing Scheme
children.definition: Defines how the price is applied to the securities account.

children.name: Name
children.definition: Account name

children.name: Alternate Id
children.definition: Available optional account identification

children.name: Name
children.definition:
Name of the group to which the account belongs, e.g. default string ‘Allow’. 
This functionality allows defining user access rules to only access certain account groups and thereby only have access to certain securities accounts.
The ‘Allow’ group is the only group available in the system as default, however, members can define more groups through NCSD Account maintenance GUI.

children.name: Identification
children.definition: Proprietary information, often a code, issued by the data source scheme issuer.

children.name: Issuer
children.definition: Entity that assigns the identification.

children.name: Scheme Name
children.definition: Short textual description of the scheme.

children.name: Holder
children.definition: Reference to the investor that is holder of the securities account. The holder is referred to through its Investor ID

children.name: NIN
children.definition: National Identity Number

children.name: GIIN
children.definition:
Global Intermediary Identification Number. The GIIN may be used by a financial institution to 
identify itself to withholding agents and tax administrations for FATCA reporting.

children.name: Investor Id
children.definition: Investor identifier

children.name: Identification
children.definition: Tax identification number or identifier.

children.name: Tax Identification Type
children.definition: Type of tax identification number or identifier.

children.name: Code
children.definition: Type of tax identification number or identifier expressed as a code.

children.name: Proprietary
children.definition: Type of tax identification number expressed as a proprietary code.

children.name: Identification
children.definition: Proprietary information, often a code, issued by the data source scheme issuer.

children.name: Issuer
children.definition: Entity that assigns the identification.

children.name: Scheme Name
children.definition: Short textual description of the scheme.

children.name: Issuer
children.definition: Entity that assigns the identifier.

children.name: Issue Date
children.definition: Date at which the identification was issued.

children.name: Expiry Date
children.definition: Date at which the identification expires.

children.name: Issuer Country
children.definition: Country that issued the tax identification.

children.name: Other identifier
children.definition: Any other identifier and the issuer seperated by a forward slash

children.name: Operator
children.definition: BIC code of the bank where the bank account is held

children.name: IBAN
children.definition: International Bank Account Number (IBAN) - identifier used internationally by financial institutions to uniquely identify the account of a customer. Further specifications of the format and content of the IBAN can be found in the standard ISO 13616 "Banking and related financial services - International Bank Account Number (IBAN)" version 1997-10-01, or later revisions.

children.name: Proprietary
children.definition: Unique identifier for an account. It is assigned by the account servicer using a proprietary identification scheme.

children.name: Lending Pool
children.definition: Indicates if the securities account is eligible for the lending pool for ISBL transactions

children.name: Supplementary Data
children.definition: Additional information that cannot be captured in the structured elements and/or any other specific block.

children.name: Place And Name
children.definition:
Unambiguous reference to the location where the supplementary data must be inserted in the message instance.
In the case of XML, this is expressed by a valid XPath.

children.name: Envelope
children.definition: Technical element wrapping the supplementary data.
